title: Budget Fashion Stores Change Shopping in Small Towns
summary: In small towns in India, new budget fashion stores like Trends and Zudio are becoming very popular. These stores sell clothes, shoes, and accessories at low prices, similar to street markets, but offer a better shopping experience with air conditioning, trial rooms, and helpful staff. People like Alka, who used to shop only in bazaars, now enjoy buying trendy and branded clothes here. This change is helping these stores grow fast, with Zudio expanding from 7 to 765 stores and earning over $1 billion. It shows how more people in small towns want affordable yet stylish fashion.

background_read: In India, many people live in small towns and often shop at street markets called bazaars for cheap clothes. Recently, new stores like Trends and Zudio have opened, offering similar low prices but with modern features like clean spaces and branded items. This is changing how people shop, as they can now buy fashionable clothes without spending a lot of money. It's part of a trend where more Indians want to look good while saving money, especially in places outside big cities.

WHAT: Budget fashion stores are becoming popular by selling cheap, trendy clothes with a better shopping experience.
WHERE: In small towns across India, such as Sangli.
WHY: Because more people want affordable and branded fashion, leading to fast growth for these stores.
